161.html:
1) Update button has been hidden.

2) Using LearnUpon API we can Add users to group ( or ) Invite them to group, but assigning manager for a group has to be done through LU Admin Interface.
There is no way we can assign a manager user to a group through API. ( no documentation or forum found in Internet regarding this Issue, Contacting LearnUpon might help )

    Now the manager user has been created automatically ( can enrol & can mark complete flags are set to false ) except assigning them to a group.

3) Existing user validation ( on the same portal ) has already been done by Email only.

4. We are not able replicate this issue ( most probably password typo  )




On Tuesday 31 March 2015 08:12 PM, dineshkumar.d@cgvakindia.com wrote:
Hi saravana,

I’ve had feedback from our client with a couple of issues –

 

1)      If you click the ‘update’ button on the shopify cart page it refreshes the screen and you lose any details entered. Does that button need to be there? If you change anything on the screen it updates automatically so I’m assuming this button could be removed to avoid confusion?

2)      Group Managers – When a Group Manager is specified they are created in LearnUpon and are ticked as a Manager in the overall Users table but they are not assigned as a Manager of the Group.  If you go into the Group and click the ‘Managers’ tab there are no Managers listed.

3)      Existing user validation – The check to see if there is an existing user in LearnUpon should be done on the email address only. The client said they tested it with 2 users with the same surname and the second user wasn’t created.

4)      The client had one instance where they received an ‘auto generated login credential fail’ but this only happened once and they haven’t been able to repeat it.  Is there anything in your logs regarding this?

 

Thanks   

regards

Hi,

1. I have an Example code for multiple custom fields : here

2. You can use any hook as long as it is fired from single product template.

3. In order to display custom fields in cart widgets, you need to edit that widget file

PLUGINDIR/woocommerce/includes/widgets/class-wc-widget-cart.php

Line No : 56 replace 'widget_title' to 'woocommerce_cart_item_name' ( in apply_filters() )


Mostly I work on US timing only. and my hourly rate is : 20USD

Actually the core has been totally re written ( which will be published in Shopify App Store ), The functionalities are same with http://sarkutils.in/rapidfilter/
Except this version has built with client side caching, which will add additional  performance boost ( It can filter hundreds of products within few seconds ) that's why it took two more days.

I have created a sample sidebar with two groups : http://www.thefarmjuicery.com/collections/beauty

You can start to add sidebars for other collections.

Note :
    Always use collections with "Manual" collection ( It won't support smart collections ). 
    Collection CSS is not responsive yet.


Works Under Progress :

    1. Now I am working on Syncing part ( If you add new collection to your store, that collection will be automatically synced with Product Filter App )
    2. Collection Page CSS, If you have a design for Sidebar & Filters  you can send to me ( Otherwise I will finish the CSS with default style - with Responsive )

196.html:
Dinesh,


Shopify Order Success

    -> Enroller module called ( with Shopify Order Object )

    1. Create group, if user requested to do so.

    2. Manager User [ this step happens if step 1 is true ]

        -> If he has Already registered with our learnupon portal, add  him as manager to this group ( Using the latest "GroupManager" API endpoint ).
      
        -> Create user with manager role if not already registered, add  him as manager to this group ( Using the latest "GroupManager" API endpoint ) .

                -> Send account welcome email notification

    3. Iterate through each Cart Line Item [ courses ]

        -> Iterate through each Enroller rows [ first name, last name, email ]

        -> If he has Already registered with our learnupon portal, enrol him for this course.

        -> Create a new User if not already registered and enrol him for this course

        -> Add him to the group ( If user requested to create a group )

                -> Send account welcome email & course enrolment notification

205.html:
Santosh,

Juices -> Our Complete Menu, that page is generated via liquid, almost all shopify features available for liquid. but our filter enabled collection.liquid is generated via shopify API, that's why alt attribute not available. unless shopify updates their API spec we have no other work around.


I will look around, and update you, if I found any workaround.



On Thursday 16 April 2015 07:34 PM, Santosh Tamhane wrote:
Hi
Regarding image hover issue. I am able to show Alt text on hover when I embed a collection on a page. Check page.alternate in our theme and the effect under COld PRessed Juices->Our Complete Menu. Can we do something or is there a workaround ?

On Wed, Apr 15, 2015 at 7:49 AM, Saravana Kumar K <sark@sarkware.com> wrote:
1. Sorting done.

2. Alt text on image hover, since shopify API doesn't includes that attributes. So we cannot use Alt attribute here.

"image": {
      "created_at": "2015-03-28T13:31:19-04:00",
      "id": 850703190,
      "position": 1,
      "product_id": 632910392,
      "updated_at": "2015-03-28T13:31:19-04:00",
      "src": "https:\/\/cdn.shopify.com\/s\/files\/1\/0006\/9093\/3842\/products\/ipod-nano.png?v=1427563879",
      "variant_ids": [
      ]
}

As you see above, they are including "alt" attribute. ( may be in future if they update their api spec, we will see ).
for more information : https://docs.shopify.com/api/product

209.html:
I am glad you liked this module.

I am not sure what you want exactly, but you can easily override "text.php" especially "render_product_field()" function.
WC Fields Factory trigger "wccpf/before/fields/rendering" action before rendering each fields. [ see LN : 36 in product-form.php ]
using "wccpf/before/fields/rendering" action you can totally override "render_product_field()" from your functions.php.
